alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 3:11PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kit Carson County through 345 PM MDT... At 311 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Stratton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Kit Carson County. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 395 and 431. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
